metadata.Title: CVE-2022-4543 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description: A flaw named "EntryBleed" was found in the Linux Kernel Page Table Isolation (KPTI). This issue could allow a local attacker to leak KASLR base via prefetch side-channels based on TLB timing for Intel systems.

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2023.01.10').
linux-allwinner package in lunar is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it.
linux-aws package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
linux-gcp package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
linux-lowlatency package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
linux-oracle package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
linux-raspi package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
linux-signed package in lunar is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2023.01.10').
linux-signed-aws package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
linux-signed-azure package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
linux-signed-gcp package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
linux-signed-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
linux-signed-kvm package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
